p: The analysis of the bioassay data showed that ULV of all three essential oils that were tested exhibit strong repellent activity against A. lineatella moths. In addition, the repellent activity of R. officinalis, was higher compared to the other two essential oils that were tested. Moths for example expressed approximately 3â€“5 fold faster moving behavior when treated with R. officinalis, compared to G. procumbens and C. citratus, respectively and for both ULV time application.
